author: __flcl
content:
What if we introduce a new field in blobSchedule settings, like this:
```
      "prague": {
         ...
      },
      "osaka": {
        "target": 9,
        "max": 12,
        "baseFeeUpdateFraction": 5007716,
        "maxPerTx": 6, // or
        "maxGasPerTx": 786432
      }
```
and start additionally declining txs above such new limit. Wdyt guys?

author: fradamt
content: By declining do you mean in the mempool or as a validity condition of blocks?

author: __flcl
content: Both

author: tersec
content: is this a backdoor way to get one of those EIPs which wasn't CFI'd?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I like it

author: tersec
content: is there much reason to include this in a part which is meant to facilitate scaling?

author: tersec
content: the putative urgency of BPOs is that they enable scaling, and people just can't wait `n` months. But it doesn't seem like a much an issue here either way

author: jtraglia
content: I like the idea too üëç

author: __flcl
content: It may help to postpone pressure on tx pool until it is scaled enough

author: __flcl
content: Or we can try to scale it and don't involve additional limits üòÑ as we have time ig

author: fradamt
content: There's no such EIP at this point right? So no change to get it included unless there's an argument later that it's a security problem for the mempool?

author: __flcl
content: No such or similar one I know about, I can try it to craft quickly

author: derekg.base
content: Is `engine_getBlobsV2` expected to be mandatory in Osaka? As compared to `engine_getBlobsV1` which is currently optional, but has a [PR for non-optional](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/628)

author: fradamt
content: Imo it should be mandatory, because it would be the way to do local block building at high blob counts

author: fradamt
content: In principle it would of course be ok if only a high percentage of the network supported it, because they would then also re-propagate it, but I don't see why wouldn't make it mandatory, it's just better if everyone supports it

author: __flcl
content: Adding an EIP

author: __flcl
content: And here is a draft https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9621

author: __flcl
content: But if you guys think it's better to include it as a part of peerdas I'm all for that, less eips - less activation bugs. Or even a part of BPO forks [EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7892) ?

author: francis.li
content: Updated the PR based on discussion, now return `null` if there's blob missing: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/630

author: fradamt
content: Personally I'd include it as part of PeerDAS, but no strong opinion

author: __flcl
content: Because it sounds like peerdas requirement, OK, updating the existing eip

author: derekg.base
content: Created a PR for this to see if there's interest in codifying it https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4262

author: __flcl
content: Blob count per tx limits as an update of peerdas EIP: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9623
